attributes.action: Add American Football to the curriculum
attributes.background: Although American Football is not common in the U.K. Just yet, it is growing into interest to many people. However many people are restricted from playing it as there are very few clubs and no schools I know of includes American Football in there education.
attributes.additional_details: There are many benefits of playing American Football. The best thing about American Football is that anyone and everyone can play it as size doesn't matter. In fact being slightly overweight or being skinny can actually benefit to many people's attention. Many people think that American Football is a very rough sport but this is not true. You have contact American Football and you have Flag American Football meaning that if you play the flagged version there will be no contact meaning no harm

attributes.action: Digital Software libraries should be considered to be assets.
attributes.background: Digital Software is everywhere in today's world, this why the UK should be the first country to consider any form of digital software to an asset to the purchaser of that digital software whether it being Operating Systems, Video Games, Music & General Digital Software.
attributes.additional_details:
It has recently come about thanks to video game journalist Chris Bratt that digital software libraries are not considered to be assets and can not be transferred to a loved one if you sadly pass away. Furthermore, when you do sadly pass away these digital libraries of software get deleted wiping all monetary value from them as the terms of service are no longer valid.  

For further information watch Chris Bratt video here.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kHLFUbU5ceI

attributes.action: Stop Parliamentary recess for Party Annual Conferences
attributes.background: I passionately believe the Parliament of the United Kingdom fails to serve the country efficiently as it is 'closed' too often and for excessive periods. If Party Conferences are necessary they should be held during summer recess or another recess period.

attributes.action: Teach Self-defense as a national curriculum
attributes.background: offer free self-defense lessons for free for children under the age of 18. This will possibly help with bullying and improve fitness

attributes.action: Add a coat of arms to the Union Flag, to better represent all nations of the U.K
attributes.background: Though iconic, the flag's design doesn't represent all of the United Kingdom. There is historical context for the omission of Wales, but if we truly are a Union of four countries, we need to show that to the world. Adding a coat of arms with four national symbols would be small, but significant.
attributes.additional_details:
In these times, the importance of the Union has been highlighted by figures across the political spectrum. 

Adding a small coat of arms to the Union Flag comprising of four symbols for each of the nations (Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland and England), would not change the issues the Union faces. But it might help restore confidence, and finally give Wales visual representation. 

It would be seen internationally, as well. A reminder, to us and to the world, that we are four nations - united.

attributes.action: change workplace drugs tests. Oral mouth swabs should be the compulsory method.
attributes.background: Urine based testing is a demeaning and very personal method of testing. Oral mouth swabs is a easy and non-invasive method. It is the method used by police for road users and should be made the compulsory method for the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: Oral mouth swabs has the ability to detect drug use within the first few hours. This is a window of time that is omitted by urine tests. Mouth swabs, with their ability to detect drug use 1-4 days after use, are the best method for impairment and post-accident testing.

attributes.action: Giving the British people the right to remove members of the Lords by petition.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition because some of the unelected members of the Lords are ignoring the will of the British people and acting in their own interests. There is no participation by the British people in who is appointed to the Lords. In a real democracy there should be a way to remove them .
attributes.additional_details: I help run a large Community Hall and a significant number of the membership when asked about the interference of the Lords into the EU referendum cannot understand why they are not answerable to anyone.

attributes.action: Assault on emergency service workers   must  carry a term of imprisonment!
attributes.background: Assaults on emergency service workers, i.e. police, fire personnel, paramedic and nurses are too frequently dealt with by caution or suspended sentences. Suspects must be prosecuted and. if convicted, receive an immediate custodial sentence of at least 6 months.

attributes.action: Close planning loophole that allows homes to be converted to care homes
attributes.background: Make "Assisted Living" a category subject to planning regulation & approval, including drug, alcohol & mental health rehab. Planning regulations need urgently to be amended to protect private residential property owners.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities can be powerless to stop homes being converted into care homes because the law is not clear enough. A new "Assisted Living" category would give local authorities and local residents proper powers to challenge new care homes being set up.

attributes.action: Add ‘RESPECT’ to the National Curriculum from 5 years upwards. Lacking Today.
attributes.background:
Many grow up with little or no respect today, no Respect for Teachers the Police, Property and the Elderly, this is very wrong in this day and age, Some Police only Get Cheek in trying to correct their behaviour and the ones above.

At one time Churches could leave them open, today it’s a No No.
attributes.additional_details:
Many youngsters are Serious Lacking Any Respect today as is Proven, Some attack Teachers and their Assistants, Elderly getting abused and Picked on, when I was young it was Instilled into us ALL at school Never to do Anything Against the Elderly and all the above, we All Respected Them 100%, we would never have thought about causing Damage or Thefts from Churches, today some do, Not all are Bad just a Select few causing Antisocial Behaviour.

Let’s try to correct things and make the Country good

attributes.action: Grant diplomatic status to Julian Assange so that he can leave the UK
attributes.background: Julian Assange of Wikileaks cannot leave the Ecuadorian Embassy in London because he fears arrest & extradition to the USA. Swedish prosecutors have dropped a rape investigation. The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention has found that he is subject to arbitrary detention.
attributes.additional_details: There is still a UK arrest warrant for Julian Assange for a breach of bail conditions related to the now dropped rape investigation. The issue is that the UK Government will not guarantee his safe passage.

attributes.action: Streamline UK education by creating a single/governmental exam board
attributes.background: I'm at my 1st year of university. A lot of time is wasted covering content covered at A level; this was also true for A level regarding GCSEs. Why? Because multiple exam boards mean students don't cover the same content, so it has to be taught again at the next level of education.
attributes.additional_details:
One exam board would stop this.

Furthermore, revision resources are poor. But, converting to one exam board will create a single/larger market for people to produce educational content for, meaning it can be higher quality.

E.g. 2 At A-level, I wanted to produce a revision site for A-level STEM subjects, however it is a waste of time because too few students would use it, because there is too much content between the 5 different exam boards.

attributes.action: Stop plans for Bradwell Nuclear Plant
attributes.background: This area is perfect for renewal energy, wind farms, solar.  Nuclear is totally unnecessary. Renewable energy is the way forward if designed to be used by the UK and not sold off.

attributes.action: Convert the EU Charter of Rights into UK law
attributes.background: The Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union is important to everybody. It gives people a voice to be heard. The Charter of Rights needs to be converted into UK law after leaving EU so that our rights as humans are fully protected both at home and abroad.
attributes.additional_details: EU Charter of Rights gives access to proper justice and proper freedom for all without partiality. The UK has had a good history on human rights and protection for its citizens both at home and abroad.

attributes.action: Change legislation around air pollution caused by fireworks, to improve health.
attributes.background: It’s the beginning of a new year and in many countries around the world, it has become a tradition to set off thousands of fireworks in elaborate displays. But if we stopped to consider the environmental impact of such extravagance, would we still choose this option or go for a safer, greener option
attributes.additional_details: Firework smoke has been shown to significantly increase breathing problems and have increased toxicity compared to traffic pollution. In this technologically advanced world we live in, surely we have the ability to come up with more inventive ways of using music, lights, and water displays to commemorate the new year.  In 2018, authorities in Dubai opted to light up the Burj Khalifa in a sensational display without fireworks, proving it can be done. We could save millions & our health-pls sign.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of money that a person signed off work on sick pay receives.
attributes.background: I'm currently receiving sick pay of £360 a month, due to being hit by a car off my motorcycle by a car driver resulting in breaking my shoulder. The £360 a month that i receive soon disappears due to bills and it's very hard to live off of this amount of money a month, when i physically cannot work.
attributes.additional_details: I'm creating this petition to help others in my situation, who physically cannot work due to a motor vehicle accident. Crashes, accidents and injuries sometimes cannot be helped, if you've been injured from the same case to mine or one similar, why should the injured party suffer due to carelessness of another person? It's certainly not fair that the injured party has to live off of £360 a month when the other person can go back to work and earn their standard living wages a month.

attributes.action: Make Mental health check ups free and compulsory yearly for anyone
attributes.background: Mental health is stigmatised so not enough people are getting the help they need by reaching out. So many people have died because of this. I want to make it compulsory to have a yearly mental health check up so everyone can get the support that they deserve.

attributes.action: Televise Government lobby briefings
attributes.background: With trust in both politicians and the mainstream media at an all time low,  government lobby briefings should be televised to demonstrate a true record of what has taken place.
attributes.additional_details: The public are sceptical that lobby briefings as reported are a true reflection of the exchanges, as can be seen from the White House press briefings, what is said is available for anyone to view impartially without media bias.

attributes.action: Retest EVERY driver every 10 years when photo card licence needs to be renewed.
attributes.background:
Currently, driving licences last until the holder reaches 70 years, but the photograph on their licence must be updated every 10 years. 
As an Approved Driving Instructor (ADI) I have to be re-tested every so-often to prove that I am "up to standard". Why not apply the same rule to all drivers?
attributes.additional_details: Driving licence photos must be renewed every 10 years. MANY drivers say "I couldn't pass my test again". We (ADI's) are required to teach "safe driving for life". Rules change. Signs change. Road layouts change. Change the licence requirements. DVSA could call the renewing licence holder for a "check" free of charge. If the licence holder passes their check DVLA will issue a renewed licence. If the holder fails the check their licence would be suspended until they pay for each check and pass.

attributes.action: The UK stays in the customs union as part of the Brexit process.
attributes.background: The UK is a trading nation and free movement of our goods within the EU is critical. Being a member does not prevent the UK from trading with other countries - we do so now. It simply means that tariffs have to be paid in certain circumstances. It would also solve the Ireland impasse at stroke.
attributes.additional_details: Most MPs support the customs union being retained but Brexiteers want it removed in order to enable this country to negotiate trade deals with other countries. Not having a trade deal does not prevent members of the union from trading with other countries. Germany for example trades a great deal with China as we do with the USA. Tariffs have to be paid in some circumstances but that does not stop trading.

attributes.action: To authorise an amended version of the 1962 proposed Altrincham and Sale bypass.
attributes.background:
The A56 carries approx. 35,000 vehicles per day with HGVs and OGVs
contributing approx. 13.5% of this figure. Resulting air pollution affects peoples health, contributing to respiratory illness, heart disease and some cancers. Noise, road accidents, traffic congestion are other associated factors
attributes.additional_details:
Starting from the M60 Carrington Spur junction with Carrington Lane, going South across Carrington Moss towards Ashton Road joining the A56 west of the new A556 bypass, giving a direct link between the M60 jnc 8 to the M56 jnc 8 and onto the M6 jnc 19 via the new A556 intersections
Linking the M60 to the A56 west will create a new circular transportation network.
STOP THIS A56 TRAFFIC NIGHTMARE -BUILD THE ALTRINCHAM AND SALE BYPASS NOW.
Please sign the petition
Please sign this petition now.

attributes.action: Make time to debate and vote on Jim McMahon's 'Votes at 16' bill in the Commons.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to make time for the House of Commons to debate and vote on Jim McMahon MP's 'Votes at 16' bill.
attributes.additional_details:
Earlier this month Jim McMahon, the Member of Parliament for Oldham West and Royton, introduced a bill to lower the Voting Age to 16. MPs who didn’t support the Bill exploited an old House of Commons rule that means that Bills that are still being debated on a Friday afternoon at 2:30pm aren’t automatically voted on. This makes it very hard for them to become law. This is not just undemocratic, this is indefensible!

http://metro.co.uk/2017/11/03/tory-mps-accused-of-filibustering-to-block-bill-lowering-the-voting-age-to-16-7052134/
https://www.parliament.uk/biographies/commons/jim-mcmahon/4569
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-41862264

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: Rebate and partially rebate stamp duty on properties purchased since 22/11/16
attributes.background: The new stamp duty rules for houses under 300k and only partial for above is great news for new buyers. I was a new buyer 5 months ago and struggled to get stamp duty together.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that following the chancellor’s revelation on the 22/11/17, all properties purchased within the last 12 months, particularly ones purchased using help to buy, should have partial or full refunds on the stamp duty in line with the chancellor’s new ruled surrounding stamp duty

attributes.action: All England, Scotland and Wales national team games available on freeview TV
attributes.background: I am English and I want to see my national team play.  I follow Rugby Union but I am unable to see live coverage of England games during the Rugby Union autumn international tests because I have to subscribe to SKY.

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Homes under £300000 for all buyers
attributes.background: Why only abolish stamp duty on houses under £300000 for first time buyers as a lot of families moving home would benefit from this too. Most first time buyers won’t benefit as much as families upsizing their house and the saving would incentify buying

attributes.action: To arm all police officers with handguns
attributes.background: I believe all police officers should be armed with handguns for officers protection. Over the last 2 years terror attacks have become increasingly regular and some could have been stopped with a simple shot from an officer. It will add security to the job of law enforcement and act as a deterrent
attributes.additional_details: In America it has been seen that police can be attacked and that a handgun can prevent that. It can also bring an end to criminal situations much faster.

attributes.action: Make Falconry in the UK licensed.
attributes.background:
Here in the UK, we are one of the only countries in the world, that does not have a falconry license.
There is a huge issue where anyone can own and breed and sell birds of prey, to people who have no experience. 
I encounter 10-12 owls and Hawks each year kept in parrot cages and rabbit hutches
attributes.additional_details:
There's 1000s of people who have birds of prey, some of these birds can kill animals up the the size of deer, so effectively they're equivalent to a dangerous weapon. 
There needs to be control on the ownership or at the least, a strict mentoring system.

attributes.action: To be compulsory for dog owners to muzzle their dogs if using extendable lead
attributes.background: A cat on my street was sleeping on his windowsill an elderly lady came onto the street with her dog on one of these leads. The dog was at least 15ft in front of lady went between a car saw the cat and fatally attacked and killed the cat, because she didn't have full control of her animal.

attributes.action: Change and restrict the dates for sale of fireworks around bonfire night.
attributes.background: We all know that bans do not work, we all know that bonfire night isn't going anywhere, but did you know that the sale of fireworks around bonfire night starts from the 15th of October to the 8th of November that's 25 days of sale. Potentially 4 weeks of fireworks going off in any one area.
attributes.additional_details:
There are members of the public who are not sensible and continuously break the law, setting off fireworks in proximity to peoples homes and even terrorising and subjecting abuse to other members of the public for up to the whole 4 weeks of sale. Unfortunately animals are also very easily abused with fireworks too, many incidents include tieing them to animals and setting them off.
I call to get the sale dates changed and restricted to less than 14 days around the time of bonfire night.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates and replace with business rates transaction charge
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  These disproportionate business rates are contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% business rates charge levied on the sales value of each transaction would be a fair arrangement and would be linked directly to the success of a retail business. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place.  The credit card holder’s physical location or credit card address is readily available for government’s re-distribution to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Make Legal Provision for Northwest Regions of the UK to hold a Legal Referendum.
attributes.background: The referendum will give all citizens in the North a chance to vote on uniting UK Northern Regions to form an autonomous independent country breaking away from the South & the UK Government with Manchester as a Northern Capital with an elected Minister best placed to serve the citizens of N/England.
attributes.additional_details: Northern citizens suffer from lower life expectancy, lack of investment in areas such as education, health, skilled training and quality employment opportunities. Lack of political influence in London/South effects the Norths capability for economic growth. The neglect in these  areas is at such an extent that the North & South could be viewed as separate countries already. (One Example) IPPR thinktank, DT infrastructure spending 2016/17 London £1,943 per person, Northwest Region £680pp.

attributes.action: Make all companies share their maternity and paternity leave policies publically
attributes.background: Many companies provide maternity leave pay above the statutory minimum and increasing numbers also offer enhanced paternity pay. These can be invaluable for employees thinking about starting or growing their family but it's often a benefit you can't find out about when you sign up for a new job.
attributes.additional_details:
Making these policies publically available would help working parents make an informed choice about which companies they want to work for and help to celebrate the companies which are the most family friendly. It would also start to bring some parity to an area of benefits which at the moment varys widely from a couple of weeks full pay to a whole year. 

Having a child is one of life's most expensive adventures and choosing an employer who supports this shouldn't be left to chance or hearsay.

attributes.action: The UK to urge the UN to add Catalonia as a non-self-governing territory.
attributes.background: The UN charter defines a Non-Self-Governing Territory (NSGT) as one “whose people have not yet attained a full measure of self-government”. Given the recent actions of the Spanish regime, as permanent member of the UNSC the UK should urge that Catalonia be added to the NSGT list maintained by the UN
attributes.additional_details: Catalonia has a unique language, culture and ethnicity. Between 1930 and 1970 Spain as a state committed various violent repressions on the Catalonians and restricted their culture, language and identity. The Spanish terrorists who did this were formally pardoned by Madrid. Currently the Catalonians are expressing their right to self-determination through a peaceful referendum, which has been violently banned by the Spanish regime.

attributes.action: Allow everyone over 55 flexibility to manage their private pension
attributes.background: The Pension Schemes Act 2015 allowed individuals from the age of 55 to be able to access their pension flexibility if they wish, but not if you had already accessed your pension prior to the new Act coming into force. I want this Government to give us the same rights to manage our pension as we wish

attributes.action: Scrap the OISC and extend the remit of the SRA to Immigration Advisers
attributes.background: The Office of Immigration Services Commissioner (OISC) is sponsored by the Home Office and regulates immigration advisers, professionals that do an important job and many are more specialised than solicitors. I believe the OISC operates in a secretive, undemocratic, biased and unfair manner.
attributes.additional_details:
It's powers are hardly challenged as it has many powers.

The fact this body quietly operates with professionals that do not have much legal knowledge can leave professionals open to unfair treatment. Surprisingly they almost always win cases in court. This cannot be right. The Home Office itself with much more infrastructure does not have this level of precision.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords/agents to discriminate against you for having pets
attributes.background:
Too many animals are put up for adoption because the landlord, letting agent and property managers won’t allow them in the homes they are letting.  
A sensible solution would be that tenants have to pay a ‘pet deposit’ which would cover any damages caused by animals living in the home.

attributes.action: There Must be Prison For Attacks on Police, Minimum Prison Sentence Six Months.
attributes.background: As we rely on the Police for Protection so they Must be Protected when Attacked, Courts should never let the Attackers off with just a Slap on the Hand, Respect is needed not only for the Police but All Emergency Services who do a Great and sometimes Difficult Job, Let’s get them some redress.
attributes.additional_details:
Far too many are getting Attacked these days and costing money in Sick pay which could be spent on Services.

Please support this and get them backing in our Courts.

Thanks

attributes.action: Reconsider the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: With the introduction of the Sugar Tax looming large, consumers are being constantly let down by the attempts of companies to avoid the higher rate of sugar tax and as a result the formulas they are releasing contain much higher levels of artificial sweeteners.
attributes.additional_details:
For some, the full sugar version of a drink not only tastes superior, it has beneficial effects, especially for people with a sensitivity to said artificial sweeteners.

A key example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). This wasn't announced in enough time for diabetic nurses to alter their recommendations.

All the tax is doing is punishing adult consumers. Why should we suffer this draconian approach to obesity?

attributes.action: Stop the NHS from removing all funding ( £15 Million annually) FOR COMBAT STRESS
attributes.background: Combat Stress is the UK's best charity helping veterans in dire need of support and treatment from PTSD. The NHS  has decided to remove ALL FUNDING for the charity £15M annually. This is a disgrace and an outrage as Combat Stress has the most experienced professional staff to deal with PTSD!
attributes.additional_details: Combat Stress currently provide residential courses for 1 week as a preparation for treatment, the 6 week intensive therapy course has helped veterans from all conflicts deal with their symptoms, nightmares, night terrors, anxiety and soo much more. Don't abandon us now, help our veterans access this essential treatment. The NHS propose that all veterans should attend a day centre which is totally unrealistic, just ask the mental health professionals at Combat Stress. Please sign this petition!!

attributes.action: Ban knives longer than 4 inches.
attributes.background:
No person needs a knife longer than 4 inches. If this law is passed then the UK will have a reduction in crime. 
Please sign the petition to make the UK a safer place.

attributes.action: Hold a Royal Commission on the future funding of the NHS and Adult Social Care
attributes.background: With the merging of the NHS and Adult Social Care briefs, now is the time to hold a Royal Commission on the future direction of a funding model for the NHS and Adult Social Care.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS and Adult Social Care briefs have recently been merged.
With ever increasing pressure on our NHS and Adult Social Care budgets, now is the time to look at a long term solution for funding, training and investment in the long-term future direction of the NHS and Adult Social Care. 
A Royal Commission should be established with a medical professional chairing it to take opinions from professionals and experts on how to take the NHS and Adult Social Care forward.

attributes.action: Ban serving MPs holding paid directorships and significant 'outside interests'
attributes.background: MPs are our representatives, who, at present are paid an adequate £74,962 in line with inflation; with expenses to carry out their role. Yet, in 2015 some 180 MPs had second jobs, earning a total of £7.4m a year. Of these 112 were Conservative MPs and 43 were Labour.
attributes.additional_details: This is wrong. MPs are elected solely to represent the people and should, therefore, dedicate their full attention to fulfilling this duty, without the need for additional employment.

attributes.action: Impose an immediate ban on the use of Polystyrene in packaging.
attributes.background: Polystyrene is easily replaced with biodegradable alternatives. Polystyrene cannot be easily recycled and usually ends up in either landfill sites or the sea. Polystyrene breaks down easily to ever smaller partials which poison the food chain, and takes thousands of years to break down.

attributes.action: All new build homes built in the last 5 years to be granted freehold interest.
attributes.background: Adverse publicity of developers including unreasonable clauses within leases on new houses has led to government consultation.  Developers should not hold power over new home buyers upon legal completion of the house.  People who buy a new build house want to be freeholders not tenants!

attributes.action: A fine to those who fail to intervene on a bully.
attributes.background: I am a parent to two happy teenagers and a pre-school educator to lovely pre-school children. I would hate it if anything bad happened to them. I would really love it if bullying was something of the past. I would like to help those who are vulnerable out there.
attributes.additional_details: I have seen many social media videos with children/teenagers being punched/kicked by bullies, and people passing by and not getting involved or stopping them. I would like people to intervene and help those who need help until parents or help arrives. Those who ignore it should be fined. It’s not only our (teacher's) duty to help vulnerable children out there. It should be everyone's out there (mum, dad, grandma/dad, aunties and uncles). Everyone should help.

attributes.action: Restrict how soon shops, supermarkets can put out for sale Easter products.
attributes.background: This is destroying the spirit of Christmas and Easter as they are becoming one event. There should be a restriction that prevents shops from doing this, eg a time restriction of for example 8 weeks before Easter.
attributes.additional_details: Walking around my local Tesco supermarket on the 4th January I was confronted with Easter chocolates for sale (and we're talking proper Easter eggs, not just small cream eggs) I also understand some retailers had Easter out on New Years day. This is wrong and erodes the meaning of these events as they are becoming like the sales, an event that happens every day. It is not good for children to see things available so quickly as this does not teach them anything about the significance of the day.

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Build Nuclear Bunkers sufficient for the population accounting for growth.
attributes.background: There is and always has been since creation a threat of nuclear attack, currently as individuals there is effectively nothing we can to protect ourselves from an attack for example from North Korea, in the event of nuclear attack millions of people would be helplessly destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: I would ask that the government ensure the construction regardless of the financial cost of nuclear shelters in major urban population centres for all persons of the area and accounting for influx of peoples to the shelters from outside of the area and population growth so that people can protect themselves from a nuclear attack, I would ask people be quickly and indiscriminately accepted into these shelters and essentials be available for prolonged life from within the shelter.
